meanings.definition: Resembling a chameleon in changing color or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The artist's chameleonlike painting seemed to shift colors as you moved around it.
meanings.sent2: Her chameleonlike ability to blend in with any crowd made her a great undercover agent.
meanings.sent3: The chameleonlike car changed from red to blue in the blink of an eye, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His chameleonlike personality made it hard to know his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The chameleonlike leaves in the forest changed from green to yellow with the seasons.

meanings.sent1: The team's chameleonlike strategy allowed them to win against any opponent.
meanings.sent2: She had a chameleonlike talent for picking up new skills quickly.
meanings.sent3: His chameleonlike behavior at work made him the go-to person for any task.
meanings.sent4: The company's chameleonlike approach to marketing helped them stay ahead of the competition.
meanings.sent5: The actor's chameleonlike ability to transform into any character amazed the audience.
